ud8.5:3.2.pli: Atha kho cundo kammāraputto tassā rattiyā accayena sake nivesane paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā pahūtañca sūkaramaddavaṁ bhagavato kālaṁ ārocāpesi:
ud8.5:3.2.en: And when the night had passed Cunda had delicious fresh and cooked foods prepared in his own home, and plenty of pork on the turn. Then he had the Buddha informed of the time, saying,

ud8.5:4.3.pli: “yaṁ te, cunda, sūkaramaddavaṁ paṭiyattaṁ tena maṁ parivisa,
ud8.5:4.3.en: “Cunda, please serve me with the pork on the turn that you’ve prepared.

ud8.5:5.2.pli: “yaṁ te, cunda, sūkaramaddavaṁ avasiṭṭhaṁ taṁ sobbhe nikhaṇāhi.
ud8.5:5.2.en: “Cunda, any pork on the turn that’s left over, you should bury it in a pit.

ud8.5:9.2.en: who had eaten the pork on the turn.

dn16:4.17.1.pli: Atha kho cundo kammāraputto tassā rattiyā accayena sake nivesane paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā pahūtañca sūkaramaddavaṁ bhagavato kālaṁ ārocāpesi:
dn16:4.17.1.en: And when the night had passed Cunda had delicious fresh and cooked foods prepared in his own home, and plenty of pork on the turn. Then he had the Buddha informed of the time, saying,

dn16:4.18.3.pli: “yaṁ te, cunda, sūkaramaddavaṁ paṭiyattaṁ, tena maṁ parivisa.
dn16:4.18.3.en: “Cunda, please serve me with the pork on the turn that you’ve prepared.

dn16:4.19.2.pli: “yaṁ te, cunda, sūkaramaddavaṁ avasiṭṭhaṁ, taṁ sobbhe nikhaṇāhi.
dn16:4.19.2.en: “Cunda, any pork on the turn that’s left over, you should bury it in a pit.

dn16:4.20.11.en: who had eaten the pork on the turn.
